titles.title: Providing for consideration of the resolution (H. Res. 524) expressing the sense of the House that Congress should complete action on the Permanent Death Tax Repeal Act of 2002, and for consideration of the resolution (H. Res. 525) expressing the sense of the House of Representatives that the 107th Congress should complete action on and present to the President, before September 30, 2002, legislation extending and strengthening the successful 1996 welfare reforms.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 107-660, by Mr. Hastings (WA).
Rule provides for consideration of H. Res. 524 and H. Res. 525. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments.
Rule provides for consideration of H. Res. 525 and H. Res. 524. Measures will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 212.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 527.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 214 - 202 (Roll no. 397).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 213 - 200 (Roll No. 398).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 9/17/2002--Reported to House without amendment. Provides for consideration of: (1) H. Res. 524, expressing the sense of the House of Representatives that Congress should complete action on the Permanent Death Tax Repeal Act of 2002; and (2) H. Res. 525, expressing the sense of the House that the 107th Congress should complete action on and present to the President, before September 30, 2002, legislation extending the 1996 welfare reforms.
